page.title: 16Kinver - Best Kept Village
page.content: Every year in Staffordshire there is a Best Kept Village Competition. It is divided into sections according to the size of the village. This year (1985) Kinver has won the prize as the Best Kept Village in its section. Everyone has to do their part keeping their gardens tidy and remembering not to drop litter. The schools have a poster competition on the theme Â£Keep Kinver Tidy'. The posters are displayed in the schools and around the village. After the Best Kept Village competition is over the posters are displayed in the library, judged and prizes awarded.
